intro: Cryptantha flexuosa, commonly known as the bentstem cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, which helps it conserve moisture. Cryptantha flexuosa is adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a hardy species found in various desert regions.
